intro: Torresea cearensis, commonly known as the Ceará torresea, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern region of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline environments. It has small, elliptical leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ecological importance and unique adaptations, it is considered a valuable species for coastal conservation efforts.
